title: Allow generation of modules with same compiler but multiple configurations
body:
I added a second compiler definition for gcc@6.4.0 with the -std=c++17 flag and callled it gcc@6.4.0-std17.

- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: rhel7
    paths:
      cc: /scratch/gartung/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-6.4.0-vg3iy5rdxcj2mnnohcnn2ogioasheuos/bin/gcc
      cxx: /scratch/gartung/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-6.4.0-vg3iy5rdxcj2mnnohcnn2ogioasheuos/bin/g++
      f77: /scratch/gartung/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-6.4.0-vg3iy5rdxcj2mnnohcnn2ogioasheuos/bin/gfortran
      fc: /scratch/gartung/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-6.4.0-vg3iy5rdxcj2mnnohcnn2ogioasheuos/bin/gfortran
    spec: gcc@6.4.0
    target: x86_64
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags:
        cppflags: -std=c++17
    modules: []
    operating_system: rhel7
    paths:
      cc: /scratch/gartung/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-6.4.0-vg3iy5rdxcj2mnnohcnn2ogioasheuos/bin/gcc
      cxx: /scratch/gartung/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-6.4.0-vg3iy5rdxcj2mnnohcnn2ogioasheuos/bin/g++
      f77: /scratch/gartung/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-6.4.0-vg3iy5rdxcj2mnnohcnn2ogioasheuos/bin/gfortran
      fc: /scratch/gartung/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-6.4.0-vg3iy5rdxcj2mnnohcnn2ogioasheuos/bin/gfortran
    spec: gcc@6.4.0-std17
    target: x86_64

I run 
spack module refresh 
and I get these warnings:

==> Warning: Could not write module file [/scratch/gartung/spack/share/spack/dotkit/linux-rhel7-x86_64/xrootd-4.6.0-gcc-6.4.0-wzvipg5.dk]
==> Warning:     --> Compiler configuration contains entries with duplicate specification (gcc@6.4.0, linux-rhel7-x86_64) in the following files:
    /scratch/gartung/spack/etc/spack/compilers.yaml: 2 times <--

It would help FNAL greatly if this worked.
